flow.descriptionCdata:
4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.09d7102f-6a58-4593-8906-a1f44be27f8e.description=operator - (\=\=, \!\=, >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold 4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.4708c3d0-d727-47d6-90ce-badb1dadbfc1.description=operator - (\=\=, \!\=, >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold 4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.543ae091-2c73-4a28-a295-e1345140d6c8.description=
Querying host's name.
4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.9d95833d-bbc5-451a-a5d7-529be4044614.prompt=username for host 4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.abf6bcd4-3d27-405c-a622-34434fb4888c.description=
Checks to see whether or not a connection exists, and if it exists checks to see if it is adequately reliable.

Inputs\:
host - The host to ping from.
username - The username for host.
password - The password for host.
lossThreshold - What percentage of packet loss you consider to be acceptable for this connection.
latencyThreshold - How long (in milliseconds) you consider to be an acceptable latency for this connection.
target - The host to ping.
characterSet - The character encoding of the target computer. The default is the RAS machine's default encoding.

Responses\:
success - The test passed.
diagnosed - A problem was found.
failure - Something went wrong.

Notes\:
1.The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must be compatible for the host and RAS systems, otherwise the command file created to execute the command becomes garbled causing an error while executing.
2. Recommended Thresholds\:
Connection Type		Loss Threshold (%)	Latency Threshold (ms)
DSL modem			2		200
Cable modem		2		200
dialup modem		2		500
ISDN Line			2		150
T1/T3/OCR			2		80
10 ethernet			2		10
Wireless			2		600
4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.d61f78e1-8196-4b7d-a58e-d6509d2c730c.prompt=password for username 4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.d6a367a6-a963-4852-b4bc-0c64b6a5c9e6.prompt=Enter a value for targetHost 4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.description=
Checks for any network errors.

Inputs\:
host - The host to check.
user - The username to login to host with.
password - The password for user.
outputPath - The network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default, the path will have to be  changed on Windows 2000 systems.
diagnostic so far - Used to chain diagnostics together, and get one report. The output of previous diagnostics, or blank.
characterSet - The character encoding of the host computer. The default is the RAS machine's default encoding.

Responses\:
success - Diagnostic successful.
failure - Something went wrong.
connectivity failure - Connection to host may be unreliable.

Note\:
The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must be compatible for the host and RAS systems, otherwise the command file created to execute the command becomes garbled causing an error while executing.
4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.e830b7c6-0d1c-4ba4-ab9f-9b5133cc3eab.prompt=Server Name - The name of the server to test the connection to. 4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.ec5c73a1-49ee-488f-9cf8-ee91f9d030e8.description=
Runs the Ping command locally. 

Input Parameters\:
targetHost - target host to ping
packetSize - size of the ping packet
packetCount - number of packets to send

Responses\:
success - the command was executed successfully
failure - the command could not be executed

Returns\:
packetsSent - the number of packets sent
packetsReceived - the number of packets received
percentagePacketsLost - the percentage of packets lost
transmissionTimeMin - minimum time taken for transmitting the packet
transmissionTimeMax - maximum time taken for transmitting the packet
transmissionTimeAvg - average time taken for transmitting the packet
returnResult - the raw output of the command
returnCode - return code from the executed command
error - the STDERR of the command
4ff3969d-650d-4a68-be27-ecb637862d63.ed2b71ef-5dcf-44bd-8c9f-87ad882e2057.description=operator - (\=\=, \!\=, >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold
flow.name: Network Diagnostic

staticBinding.value: Ensure you provided a valid hostname. Ensure DNS is running.
Ensure WMI is enabled and that you provided a valid username/password.
Network connection is unreliable. Check for- 1. high network traffic 2. failing network cables, switches, or network interface cards. 3. invalid output path, if specified.
